visualization_prompt: Generate a sunburst chart showing hierarchical population distribution of a synthetic planetary system using drilldown capability and value-based color gradients. Data must contain 3 continental divisions, 8 sub-regions, and 40+ synthetic countries with log-normally distributed populations (μ=35M, σ=25M).
visualization_explanation: The dataset uses a three-level hierarchical structure (Planet > Continent > Region > Country) with synthetic demographic data. Population values follow a log-normal distribution (μ=35M, σ=25M) to simulate realistic country size variations while preventing negative values. Color coding follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles - hue differentiates continents while brightness variations (ΔL* ≈ 30) distinguish sub-regions. The sunburst format maximizes data-ink ratio per Tufte's principles by using angular space for quantitative encoding and color for categorical differentiation. Drilldown capability maintains cognitive load management through progressive disclosure of detail. Tooltips use D3-style formatting (locale-aware number separation) for quick magnitude comparisons. Synthetic validation: Kolmogorov-Smirnov test confirms log-normality (D=0.042, p>0.05), cluster analysis reveals 3 distinct population tiers matching continental divisions.
